name: 2014 Do The Ton Bike of the Month Calendar
description:
*****PRE ORDER******SHIPPING FIRST OF JAN 2014******

The often talked about but never created, bike of the month calendar from our friends at Do The Ton! This 2014 Calendar contains all 12 BOTM winners from this year. It's a 13 x 19 shop calendar, printed on 80# & 100# gloss text. The photos are all beautifully done and will easily cover up that hole you punched in the wall last week. It includes U.S. & Canada holidays for those "other" people like Tim...

name: Kick Me
description: Ever kicked a bike till you puked? Ever look down and see that your right leg was bigger than your left? Ever wonder why the hell kick start was even invented? Men...that's why. The motorcycle God's knew what they were doing when crafting the kick start. In the beginning, motorcycles weren't just sitting around waiting for any jack ass to hop on and scoot down the road. You had to prove yourself and that right of passage was none other than kicking the shit out of something until you literally created fire.

name: Kick it!
description: Ever kicked a bike till you puked? Ever look down and see that your right leg was bigger than your left? Ever wonder why the hell kick start was even invented? Men...that's why. The motorcycle God's knew what they were doing when crafting the kick start. In the beginning, motorcycles weren't just sitting around waiting for any jack ass to hop on and scoot down the road. You had to prove yourself and that right of passage was none other than kicking the shit out of something until you literally created fire.

name: Standard Oil 4" Patch
description:
Rust Revival patches are here!

4" patch. Heat seal backing.

name: In Rust We Trust
description:
E pluribus unum is probably better fitting for vintage motorcycle builders than U.S. Currency. "Out of many, one" and your damn right when it comes to old bikes. You know good and well that 74 speedster you've got sitting in the garage is a mechanical Frankenstein, piece milled together from at least four other bikes, probably not even the same make and model. You've labored hours forcing bolts off, grinding steel, and tweaking perfection out o that old junk. At the end of the day it's gonna be more solid and reliable than a German Panzer. You've toiled long hours to earn your motor currency. Get out there and spend it on some twisty roads. E pluribus unum - In Rust We Trust

Printed on a 4.5Oz, 100% Pre-Shrunk Spun Cotton Tee for the sexiest of feels as you rip through the backroads.

name: Spark After Dark
description:
Whats true for the tube is true for the lightning in your motor. Lets all celebrate the awesomeness of spark plugs and draw awareness to the fact you can't just go dropping these things in there all willy-nilly. Watch your step, mind the gap.

Printed on a 4.5Oz, 100% Pre-Shrunk Spun Cotton Tee for the sexiest of feels as you crawl around looking for that dropped plug.

name: British Is Better
description:
Calm down, calm down. It's a matter of opinion here whether your talking bikes, music, or ladies but trust us, Britain made some fine ladies.

Printed on a 4.5Oz, 100% Pre-Shrunk Spun Cotton Tee, comfy enough to wear while your arguing with the guy wearing the Mod in America Shirt.

name: Skull Mechanic 2.0
description:
O.K., so the skull isn't the friendliest guy in the garage but he sure looks like someone you want on your side when the wrench hits the concrete.

Skull Mechanic 2.0 MonoVision

Printed on a 4.5Oz, 100% Pre-Shrunk Spun Cotton Tee, comfy enough to wear while swapping out a motor.

name: Muffler Head
description:
Remember that time you took your cousin's dirt bike, jumped it over the driveway, and face planted into the gravel because you had no other option than to roll that throttle wide open and haul ass over that home made ramp? Family honor was at stake, glory could be tasted in the form or a rich mix of 2-stroke fumes and winning was the only way to end that day.

O.K. let's not dwell on the past here but if you wanna relive the moment and come off looking like you cleared that jump, slip into one of these vintage Muffler Head tees. Printed on a vintage 3.2 oz. tri-blend tee for that soft 70's feel.

name: Standard Oil
description:
We cant promise you'll make oil barrels full of cash like John D. Rocker and the boys but you'll sure as shit look good trying. Rockefeller took a chance on oil and it paid off but he put some clothes on before he got out there and did it! Grab one these tees, take some chances, and go make millions.

This is the flagship logo tee from Rust Revival. Printed on a 4.5Oz, 100% Pre-Shrunk Spun Cotton Tee for the sexiest of feels as you crawl around the garage floor looking for screws.

name: Murder Wolves
description:
Always wanted to join that bad ass motorcycle gang but just couldn't bring yourself to beat the hell out of someones grandma during initiation? As much as that sort of thing proves ultimate manliness, Rust Revival has a little easier admission process into the gates of motorcycle club greatness. 

Printed on a 4.5Oz, 100% Pre-Shrunk Spun Cotton Tee for the sexiest of feels as you roll into the parking lot like a wild ass beast.

name: Sparky Poster
description:
To further celebrate the awesomeness of Spark Plugs, Rust Revival has gone and printed up a batch of posters to say thanks, Sparky. Hang this guy on the shop wall as a reminder to always mind your gap.

Printed right here in U.S.A. on 14pt C1S. A poster so thick you could use it as a ramp to load your bike up a small incline.

name: Sparky
description:
Whats true for the tube is true for the lightning in your motor. Lets all celebrate the awesomeness of spark plugs and draw awareness to the fact you can't just go dropping these things in there all willy-nilly. Watch your step, mind the gap.

Printed on a 4.5Oz, 100% Pre-Shrunk Spun Cotton Tee for the sexiest of feels as you crawl around looking for that dropped plug.

name: Mod In America
description:
There is no denying the Japanese hit a home run with the Honda CB line of bikes. They are simple and reliable but as Americans (and Canadians) we just can't help but take shit apart. It's not that Honda did anything wrong, we just like to see how much stuff we can tear off of something and it still work.

Mod In America

Printed on a 4.5Oz, 100% Pre-Shrunk Spun Cotton Tee for the sexiest of feels as you wrench off every last piece of that bike and toss it in the "probably don't need this" pile.

name: Mono Wheel
description:
Here we have U.S. Patent No. 92,528 by Richard C Hemmings of New Haven, Connecticut, 1869. Dick Hem decided to head over to the hipster tavern one evening and jack a bicycle from one of those new wave idiots. He then proceeded to cafe the hell out of it until it was the most dangerous machine in town. This fine piece of Connecticut enginnering could arguably be the first american cafe racer using some great mods like hand cranking and no steering.

Mono Wheel

This is the flagship logo tee from Rust Revival. Printed on a 4.5Oz, 100% Pre-Shrunk Spun Cotton Tee for the sexiest of feels as lean that racer into the turn.

name: Skull Mechanic
description:
O.K., so the skull isn't the friendliest guy in the garage but he sure looks like someone you want on your side when the wrench hits the concrete.

Skull Mechanic

Printed on a 4.5Oz, 100% Pre-Shrunk Spun Cotton Tee, comfy enough to wear while swapping out a motor.

name: Piston Pete
description:
In the late 1700's a Scotsman by the name of James Watt married his cousin and then developed what we know today as the modern steam engine. You can't really top bad assery of that degree and the point here is, James Watt is that guy we all wanna be. You can't marry your cousin but you can give Mr. Watt a big thumbs up by proudly displaying his fine work with one of our tees.

Printed on a 4.5Oz, 100% Pre-Shrunk Spun Cotton Tee, keeping it classy while you drop a new set of rings on.

name: Rust Revival 4" Sticker
description: The Rust Revival 4" sticker for your decal enjoyment. Put them on your tool box, welding helmet or favorite girls face. They just look good on anything! Printed on premium vinyl and UV coated for outdoor applications.

name: Kiley's Garage 3" Sticker
description: Kiley's Garage 3" sticker for your decal enjoyment. Put them on your bike, truck window oryour favorite opossum's house. they just look good anywhere! Printed on premium vinyl and UV coated for outdoor applications.

name: Mod In America Poster
description:
There is no denying the Japanese hit a home run with the Honda CB line of bikes. They are simple and reliable but as Americans (and Canadians) we just can't help but take shit apart. It's not that Honda did anything wrong, we just like to see how much stuff we can tear off of something and it still work.

Mod In America Poster 14" x 20"

Printed on a 130# C1S Stock. What does that even freaking mean? Slap 4 casters on this thick piece of paper and roll yourself up under that bike!

name: Do The Ton Poster
description:
You probably haven't got that CB 350 up to a Ton yet but rest assured this poster can make up the difference hanging on the shop wall. Like a Sherpa to guide you on your climb to the Ton, the skull mechanic will enlighten, inspire and probably cover up the hole you punched in the wall after that stupid ass wiring diagram pissed you off.

Do The Ton Poster 14" x 20"

Printed on 130# C1S Stock. What does that even freaking mean? When the old lady throws the half empty IPA bottle at you from across the room for spending more time in the garage than in the bedroom you can use it as a shield.
